utilities

Architecture Name Mapper module

This module stores the names of all nodes, topics and services of the architecture.

surveillance_robot.architecture_name_mapper.tag_log(msg, producer_tag)[source]

Function used to label each log with a producer tag.

Parameters

  • msg (str) – message to print on screen

  • producer_tag (str) – tag name of the producer of the message

Returns

formatted string

Return type

string (str)

Environment module

This module stores the knowledge about the environment that the find_qr module discovers.

class surveillance_robot.environment.statement(location, door)[source]

Bases: object

This class represents a statement of the environment.

stated()[source]

Function to call when the statement have been stated.

State Machine Helper module

This module manages subscribers and client requests for the module state_machine through the helper class. It provides several useful methods to exchange information with the ontology, thanks to the api provided by the *armor_api* library. This module has several interfaces with orther modules, such as battery_manager, find_qr, planner and controller modules.

Subscribes to:

/map/statement /state/battery_low

Client of:

/state/recharging

Action client of:

/motion/planner /motion/controller

surveillance_robot.state_machine_helper.format(oldlist, start, end)[source]
Function to format a list of strings.

It cuts the elements of the old list between the start and end characters, returning the formatted list. It relies on the re python library.

Parameters

  • oldlist (str[]) – The old list of strings to format.

  • start (char) – Starting character to start cutting in every string.

  • end (char) – Ending character to end cutting in every string.

Returns

The formatted list of strings.

Return type

newlist (str[])

class surveillance_robot.state_machine_helper.helper[source]

Bases: object

This class is the state machine helper. It stores useful variables, functions and ros callbacks. It is widely used by the scripts.state_machine module.

_Battery_cb(msg)[source]

Callback of the topic /state/battery_low, that triggers when the robot needs to recharge or when the robot is completely charged. It changes the battery_low flag accordingly with the message received.

_Buildmap_cb(stat)[source]

Callback of the topic /map/statement used for building the ontology. The message received is of kind ‘Statement’ and contains a location coupled with a door. If the message is empty, it means that the map is completed, so it reises the map_completed flag.

build_the_map()[source]

Function used by the scripts.state_machine.Buildmap class; it waits until the map is completed, than disjoints all individuals in the ontology, asks the reasoner to reason with the given ontology and queries it for locations that are corridors.

control_robot()[source]

Function used by the scripts.state_machine.Controller class; it makes a request to the action service that controls the robot through viapoints. It waits until the goal point has been reached, updates the ontology and then exits.

plan_path()[source]

Function used by the scripts.state_machine.Planner class; it makes a request to the action service that plan the viapoints between the actual and the goal positions. The goal position is choosen randomically. It waits until the path is planned, then exits.

query_the_ontology()[source]

Function used by the scripts.state_machine.Query class; it asks the ontology about the locations that the robot can reach and chooses one of them according to the battery level of the robot and on the surveillance policy.

Returns

string to have a battery_low transition ‘reach_location’ (str): string to have a reach_location transition

Return type

‘battery_low’ (str)

reason()[source]

Function to make the reasoner reason concerning the ontology.

recharge()[source]

Function used by the scripts.state_machine.WaitFull class; it makes a request to the service that recharges the battery. This service is blocking, and returns only when the battery is fully charged. Then, it puts down the battery_low flag.

surveillance_policy(reachable_loc)[source]

Function to choose the next location among the reachable ones. It performs the following surveillance policy: - It mainly stays on corridors - If a reachable location is URGENT, it should visit it.

Parameters

reachable_loc (str[]) – list of reachable locations

Returns

choosen location among the reachable ones

Return type

loc (str)
